Title: Mihr and his Friends Slaughter Dog- and Wolf-headed Cannibals
Medium: ink and pigments on laid paper
Description: On this folio from Walters manuscript W.645, Mihr and his friends slaughter dog- and wolf-headed cannibals.
Keywords: Islamic; Persian; Safavid; Book; Codex; Illumination; Illustration; Manuscript; Iran Literature -- Poetry
Provenance: 'Abduhu Muhammad Kazim [date and mode of acquisition unknown] [oval seal on fol. 113b]; 'Ismat Zinat Sultan, 1249 AH/AD 1833 (?) [mode of acquisition unknown] [square seal dated 12(?)49 AH/AD 1833 on fol. 114a]; Henry Walters, Baltimore [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Nur al-Din `Abd al-Rahman ibn Ahmad Jami (Persian, died 898 AH/AD 1492)
